column2: TENNESSEE DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: Tennessee
column6: TN

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign indicates:
column4: a church zone ahead.
column6: a side road.

column2: 2. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 3. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks have the right-of-way
column6: Hill

column2: 5. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 6. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.

column2: 7. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 8. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: signal.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 9. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates road user services.
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 10. BAC is expressed in:
column4: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column6: percentage of alcohol to blood.
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 11. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Pennant
column6: Triangle

column2: 12. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.

column2: 13. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are fatigued.
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 14. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: signal the train to stop.
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 15. Alcohol:
column4: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 16. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: Only right turns are allowed.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 17. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 18. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
column6: always stop at the crosswalk.
column8: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

column2: 19. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 20. With a BAC of .10%, you are _______ times more likely to cause an accident than if you were sober.
21. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 23. It is illegal to turn around near a curve when the driver cannot:
column4: drive on the shoulder of the road.
column6: see at least 500 feet in each direction.

column2: 24. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
column6: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
column8: proceed because you have the right-of-way.

column2: 25. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column4: under no circumstances.
column6: only during rush hour traffic.
column8: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 26. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 27. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: you must turn right.
column6: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 28. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column4: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.
column6: follow other vehicles closely.
column8: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.

column2: 29. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
column6: to the pedestrian.

column2: 30. This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
column4: a railroad crossing.
column6: a dead-end street.
